did.unittitle: Ellen Forman papers on the South Street Dance Company

bioghist.p: Ellen Forman (1945-1990) was a pioneer of modern dance in Philadelphia. Forman co-founded and directed the South Street Dance Company from 1974 until 1990. She was well known for her reconstruction and performance of the dances of Isadora Duncan, as well as her own choreography. She produced and performed in a series of five annual concerts from 1985-1990 entitled “Body/Language” which showcased innovative artists’ work which connected movement and text.

scopecontent.p: The collection documents the South Street Dance Company and Forman's involvement with it. Records include: business records, including board of director meeting minutes, financial and development records, payroll records, grant award letters, contracts, and mailing lists; records related to specific programs, including "Dance By the Sea," "Your Spirit at the Window, a Solo Tribute to Isadora Duncan", and records of the company's performances with young audiences; press releases, programs, flyers, posters, clippings,and reviews; correspondence, including thank you notes from school children, letters from subscribers, journalists, and staff of other arts organizations; photographs, slides, video and audio recordings, props and costumes and a mannequin.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
